intro: Serjania lupulina var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf serjania, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically narrow and elliptical in shape. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The bark and leaves of this plant have been used in traditional medicine for their potential health benefits.
